meanings.definition: To move backward or return to a previous state.
meanings.sent1: After getting lost, he started regressing to find his way back home.
meanings.sent2: The car was regressing down the hill slowly.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept regressing back to the same spot on the couch, much to the amusement of its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was regressing to childhood memories, vivid and colorful.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was regressing in time, revealing a bygone era.

meanings.definition: To decline or deteriorate in quality or performance.
meanings.sent1: The team's performance was regressing with each game they played.
meanings.sent2: The health of the plant was regressing due to lack of sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cake kept regressing in taste as more sugar was added, creating a comical disaster.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was regressing like a deflating balloon, slowly losing its strength.
meanings.sent5: The relationship was regressing, turning sour with each passing day.
